main.name: Léon van de Beek
main.description: I am an embedded systems engineer aiming to make the world smarter and more connected
main.bio: I am an open, extravert and enthousiastic person that combines a skill in working with people and collaborating with a real passion for technology. I have many interests, but my main ones would be Containerization, (Home) Automation, Infrastructure, self-hosting and embedded devices.
main.contactmessage: Wish to get in contact with me? Don't hesitate to shoot me a message in the contact form or through any of my socials!

resume.skillmessage: During my Masters and my previous work experiences you have seen above, I have acquired a lot of knowledge about and experience with many programming languages. I tried to visualize below:

education.description: During my two year masters I further developed my skills as an embedded systems engineer, learning about resource budgets, SoC design and much more.
During my Bachelors I learned a lot about general computing, algorithms, how to write and organize code, web development, cryptology, app design, etc..

work.title: Graduation project UWB localisation
work.description: During my graduation project I altered firmware of the new NXP Trimension UWB chipsets written in C++ to enable capturing of chip specific variables. I also wrote scripts to capture this data and processed it into insightful graph and statistics. My work helped IMEC understand the accuracy of the chipset in a multitude of scenarios and assisted the team in reproducing these results.

work.title: Internship Device managament
work.description: During my internship at Signify I was working for the very well known Philips Hue smart lighting system. I was exploring the possibilities of developing our own Embedded Operating System based on the Yocto project. Features of interest to us are virtualization, connectivity and a lot of hardening and security.

work.title: Software developer
work.description: After graduating and travelling Asia for almost 4 months, returning home in the middle of the Covid-19 pandemic, I managed to get a position as a software engineer at Prodrive.I mainly worked on maintaining and building new static and dynamic C++ librariesthat we use for our Automatic Electronic Test (AET) systems.This also involved a greater detail in documentation, version control and CI/CD that I had ever experienced before.When my Master started in September of 2020, after working full-time for 5 months, I converted my contract with Prodrive to part-time 12 hours a week.

work.title: Software Engineering Project (SEP)
work.description: This project was my first experience with Software development on a large scale with a group of 9 persons. We worked on a system for collecting and presenting data collected from sensors in farm fields and online API’s. We used ReactJS for the front-end and a MYSQL database.

work.title: Member of the board
work.description: As a member of the Central Introduction Committee (CIC) I have been responsible for the organization of the introduction week of 2019 of the Eindhoven University of Technology with over 2500 participants. My main responsibilities were permits, stage design/management and artist hospitality. Our busiest evening saw over 4000 unique visitors.

work.title: Administrative assistant
work.description: As the administrative assistant of Prof. Jaime Gómez Rivas and the Photonics for Energy group at DIFFER I was responsible for a variety of tasks. These ranged from creating the new website for the group to organizing visits of international visitors and ordering of new equipment for the laboratories.

work.title: Section leader
work.description: After starting out as a stock clerk 4 years earlier I started taking over tasks and responsibilities of my own section leader and in November of 2015 I was promoted to section leader myself. My responsibilities included communicating with clients and suppliers, making work schedules while at the same time keeping the safety of the customers and my fellow employees into account.
